intro: Anil stipularis, commonly known as the slender stipule plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweed and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent corona. Anil stipularis is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
